html: Whether through bankruptcy and foreclosure, anarchy and civil war, or enemy invasion, Jehovah’s people’s homes and workplaces lie “desolate,” “deserted,” or “laid waste” (lesamma) as a consequence of their predatory enterprises. Where agriculture still exists, the land fails to yield its increase for lack of rain (v 6). A ten-acre vineyard yields just one “bath” of wine, or five gallons. A “homer” of seed, or six bushels, yields only an “ephah”—less than a bushel. Just as Jehovah’s people have produced inferior fruit spiritually (vv 2-4), so their land does physically (Isaiah 7:23-25; 17:4-6; 33:9).
